qas.question: Which is Asia's largest christian nation?
Garuda is the national symbol of which 2 countries?
Which religion is dominant on the Island of Bali?
Name the most Muslim populous region in Asia?
What is the worlds most populated Hindu nation?
Where are tribal religions still occasionally practiced?

context: Religions and peoples are diverse in Southeast Asia and not one country is homogeneous. In the world's most populous Muslim nation, <a3_0>Indonesia<a3_0/>, <a2_0>Hinduism<a2_0/> is dominant on islands such as <b5_0>Bali<b5_0/>. Christianity also predominates in the rest of the part of the Philippines, New Guinea and Timor. Pockets of Hindu population can also be found around Southeast Asia in Singapore, Malaysia etc. Garuda (Sanskrit: Garuḍa), the phoenix who is the mount (vahanam) of Vishnu, is a national symbol in both <a1_0>Thailand and Indonesia<a1_0/>; in the Philippines, gold images of Garuda have been found on Palawan; gold images of other Hindu gods and goddesses have also been found on Mindanao. Balinese Hinduism is somewhat different from Hinduism practised elsewhere, as Animism and local culture is incorporated into it. Christians can also be found throughout Southeast Asia; they are in the majority in <b7_0>East Timor and the <a0_0>Philippines<b7_0/><a0_0/>, Asia's largest Christian nation. In addition, there are also older tribal religious practices in <b8_0>remote areas<b8_0/> of Sarawak in East Malaysia,Highland Philippines and Papua in eastern Indonesia. In Burma, Sakka (Indra) is revered as a nat. In <a4_0><b6_0>Vietnam<b6_0/><a4_0/>, Mahayana Buddhism is practised, which is influenced by native animism but with strong emphasis on Ancestor Worship.
